intro: Eriospermum pubescens, commonly known as the hairy eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of hairy, succulent leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a dense cluster, and bloom during the warmer months. Eriospermum pubescens is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
